title: XRE family transcriptional regulator detector
description: This feature specifically detects XRE (Xenobiotic Response Element) family transcriptional regulators and other helix-turn-helix domain-containing proteins. The activation consistently occurs at or immediately adjacent to these regulatory proteins. The XRE family includes transcriptional regulators involved in stress response, mobile genetic element control, and various metabolic functions. The pattern is highly consistent across examples from different bacterial genomes, showing precise, localized activation. The feature appears most active in high G+C Gram-positive bacteria (Actinobacteria), including Mycolicibacterium, Nocardiopsis, Pseudarthrobacter, and related genera, suggesting potential taxonomic specificity or bias toward these bacterial groups.
